metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3737 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in python. An improperly handled HTTP response in the HTTPclient code of python may allow a remote attacker, who controls the HTTPserver, to make the client script enter an infinite loop, consuming CPUtime. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
